list_definition.definition: given to only one individual or group etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The story is exclusive to this newspaper.

list_definition.definition: (of a group etc) not easily or readily mixing with others or allowing others in

list_ex_of_english: The possible outcomes in the module are both exclusive and exhaustive.
Likewise, other factors may affect whether one can justifiably give exclusive propositions decisive assent.
The elements of our descriptive domains are neither mutually exclusive nor independent.
The national narrative is based on an attempt to maintain an exclusive monopoly over truth, pain, victimhood, justice.
I think it is clear, however, that these terms are inclusive rather than exclusive in their force.
In addition to the non-exclusive relationships found, there was also the nature of the discriminating factors to be taken into consideration.
Based on our findings, perceptual similarity may qualify as a sort of conclusive evidence for two-year-olds that labels do not denote mutually exclusive categories.
Furthermore, individual liberation and private morality are not mutually exclusive ideals.
